page.title: 17The Gloucester Journal
page.content: Gloucester Flying Machine... On Steel Springs (in Two Days)... Sets out from John Turner's, at the Coach Office in the Lower Northgate Street, Gloucester, every Monday, Wednesday and Friday and on the same days from the Bolt-and-Tun Inn at Fleet Street, London; both coaches lie at the New Inn in Oxford, and set out from thence every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday at five o'clock for Gloucester and London. The price as usual. Each passenger allowed 20lb in weight: all above to be paid for as usual. Perform'd (if God permit) by W. and J. Turner. N.B. They will not be responsible for Money, Plate, Jewels, Watches and other things of value unless booked as such. Gloucester Journal..6th April 1756.
